metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3733 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
There's a flaw in urllib's AbstractBasicAuthHandler class. An attacker who controls a malicious HTTP server that an HTTP client (such as web browser) connects to, could trigger a Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDOS) during an authentication request with a specially crafted payload that is sent by the server to the client. The greatest threat that this flaw poses is to application availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3733` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.8 - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04
libpython3.8 - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04
libpython3.8-minimal - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04
libpython3.8-stdlib - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04
libpython3.8-testsuite - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04
python3.8 - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04
python3.8-examples - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04
python3.8-full - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04
python3.8-minimal - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04
python3.8-venv - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04
No subscription required

idle-python3.9 - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
libpython3.9 - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
libpython3.9-minimal - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
libpython3.9-stdlib - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
libpython3.9-testsuite - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
python3.9 - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
python3.9-examples - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
python3.9-full - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
python3.9-minimal - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
python3.9-venv - 3.9.5-3~20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> code affected in hirsute and devel is already patched, so both releases in python3.9 are not affected.

criterions.comment: python3.8 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04').
python3.9 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.9.5-3~20.04.1').
